chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Howard L. Hoffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Howard L. Hoffman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Howard L. Hoffman was found guilty of Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).
  • Howard L. Hoffman was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to sign up for Probation by 12:00 pm November 18, 2020.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Costs due within 60 days.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-NO CONCTACT whatsoever with the Victim, Victim's Family or their residence.
-Complete Cognitive Intervention Programming.
-Shall comply with all recommendations from the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY:  Philip A. Helgeson, DF: Howard L. Hoffman appeared.  Court called at 2:30 p.m.  Includes 14CF419 & 14CT206.  Set for Court Trial.  ADA Sortedahl recites the agreement.  State's Ex. 1 (CD) O/R,  State's Ex. 2 (CD)O/R & State's Ex. 8 (CD) O/R.  State publishes CDs for the Court.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct 1 in 14CF419.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and stays the conviction  of Ct 1 in 14CF419 upon full performance of the DJOC.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct. 3 in 14CF419.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 3 in 14CF419.  DE pleads No contest to Ct 1 in 14CT206. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct. 1 in 14CT203.  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 14CF419  without prejucice & Ct. 2 in 14CT206 is merged in and dismissed.  Sentencing arguments.  DE makes statement.  Court reads and signs the  DJOC on Ct. 1 for 14CF419. Court orders:

Ct. 1 in 14CF419:
- Bond remains in effect for the 5 years the DJOC is in place. 
- Court costs of $268.00 

Ct. 3 in 14CF419:
S/W 2 years probation with conditions
- Finish treatment at the VA Hospital for PTSD and follow through with any recommended treatments by doctors or counselors.
- It is hereby ordered, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sergeant Mark Volz of the North Hudson Police Department and Officer Robert Larson of the Hudson Police Department including their families & residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- DE to sign up for probation on 04/23/2015
- Court costs of $243.00

Ct. 1 in 14CT206
- 60 days St. Croix County Jail with Huber privileges
- Credit for 3 days served.  
- AODA with follow through with any recommended therapy or treatment
- 24 months Driver License Revocation
- 24 month IID
- Court costs of $1,694.00
- $52.00 restitution to the North Hudson Police Department
- 20 days to appeal

*Includes 14CF419 and 14CT206*

Bond is to be Co-Signed by defendant's wife SURETY NAME: Delia Hoffman

*It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sgt Mark V. or his family/residence and Officer Robert L. or his family/residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

*Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Status conference on October 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA: Philip A. Helgeson, Alexis S. Mckinley, DF:  Howard L. Hoffman appeared from jail.   Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Status conference scheduled for October 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 29, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sgt Mark Volz or his family and Officer Robert Larson or his family.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
